intro: Restio vilis, commonly known as the common restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often forming dense stands along the shoreline. Restio vilis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
